CatDescriptText: Hansel Curtis, messenger, 2508 Hallet Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 17, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you believe that city patrolmen and firemen should be required to work more than 40 hours per week?" answer reads: "No. Their regular duties are enough.  Sometimes their duties are so strenuous during normal hours that for them to work overtime would take away from their efficiency."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Hansel Curtis wearing fedora, eyeglasses, and herringbone suit jacket, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
